hook.text: Employees who negotiate their starting salary earn $1 million more over their career than those who don't.

buildup.text: Salary negotiations feel asymmetric â€” the employer has more options and more information about pay ranges.

discovery.text: But the employer has already invested time and money selecting you. Their BATNA is restarting the search.

twist.text: Most employers expect negotiation. Not negotiating signals either desperation or ignorance of your market value.

climax.text: Research market rates, cite your value, and negotiate with confidence. The offer is almost never the final number.

punchline.text: The worst they can say is no. The cost of not asking is $1 million.
